Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Baldwin \Bald"win\, n. (Bot.) A kind of reddish, moderately acid, winter apple. [U.S.] [1913 Webster]

Baldwin n 1: United States author who was an outspoken citic of racism (1924-1987) [syn: {James Baldwin}, {James Arthur Baldwin}] 2: English statesman; member of the Conservative Party (1867-1947) [syn: {Stanley Baldwin}, {1st Earl Baldwin of Bewdley}] 3: an American eating apple with red or yellow and red skin
